pkgmetadata.longdescription: Maximum Likelihood Analysis of Circular Data // A series of wrapper functions to implement the 10 maximum likelihood models of animal orientation described by Schnute and Groot (1992) DOI:10.1016/S0003-3472(05)80068-5. The functions also include the ability to use different optimizer methods and calculate various model selection metrics (i.e., AIC, AICc, BIC). The ability to perform variants of the Hermans-Rasson test and Pycke test is also included as described in Landler et al. (2019) DOI:10.1186/s12898-019-0246-8. The latest version also includes a new method to calculate circular-circular and circular-linear distance correlations.
